document_data.caption: A map showing the Sanrach Mountains encircling Samarach.
document_data.name: Sanrach Mountains
document_data.mainbody: The '''Sanrach Mountains''' were the dominant geographical feature within [[Samarach]] on the [[Chultan Peninsula]] of [[southwest Faer√ªn]].
document_data.Geography: The Sanrach Mountains isolated Samarach from [[Thindol]] in the east and [[Chult]] in the west. They fully encircled Samarach and the [[Sanrach Basin]], stretching for hundreds of miles along the western, eastern, and northern border. Several passes, including [[Sorlmar Pass]] and [[Narubel Pass]], allowed passage through the mountains. The mountains also served to halt the jungles of [[Chult]] from pressing further east.
document_data.Inhabitants: The heavily forested eastern slopes of the western arm of the Sanrach Mountains supported populations of [[blood ape]]s and [[cloaked ape]]s.
